data: Most likely a marble funerary plaque, but no information is provided by Fazello or Gualtherus (Bitto places unjustified faith in Gualtherus' placing of the text within the form of a base with mouldings top and bottom, ignoring the fact that this is a standard generic way of framing a text in Gualtherus' edition).
Fazello records hederae in lines 1 and 3, Gualtherus in line 1 only.

First recorded in Termini Imerese by Fazello, as one of several texts in private houses in the town, in this case specifically 'in domo Garofali'. Gualtherus subsequently (1624) recorded it among the inscriptions of Messana, where he saw it 'in vico Byzantinorum apud Pet. Stagnum eq.'
Gualtherus offers the last eye-witness account and it has not been seen since.
F. Thomæ Fazelli... de rebus Siculis decades duæ
Tommaso Fazello, F. Thomæ Fazelli... de Rebus Siculis Decades Duæ (Panormi: Panormi, 1558)
Siciliae obiacentium insular et Bruttiorum antiquae tabulae cum animadversionibus Georgii Gualtheri
G. Gualtherus, Siciliae Obiacentium Insular et Bruttiorum Antiquae Tabulae Cum Animadversionibus Georgii Gualtheri (Panormi, 1624)
Siciliæ obiacentium insular. et Bruttiorum antiquæ tabulæ, cum animadversionib
G. Gualtherus, Siciliæ Obiacentium Insular. et Bruttiorum Antiquæ Tabulæ, Cum Animadversionib (Messanae: apvd Petrvs Bream, 1624), http://arachne.uni-koeln.de/books/Gualtieri1624
Siciliae et objacentium insularum veterum inscriptionum nova collectio

Gabriele Lancillotto Castelli principe di Torremuzza, Siciliae et Objacentium Insularum Veterum Inscriptionum Nova Collectio (Panormus: Excudebat Cajetanus Maria Bentivenga, 1769), http://arachne.uni-koeln.de/books/Castelli1769
Siciliae et objacentium insularum veterum inscriptionum nova collectio prolegomenis et notis illustrata, et iterum cum emendationibus, & auctariis evulgata

Gabriello Lancellotto Castelli Principe di Torremuzza, Siciliae et Objacentium Insularum Veterum Inscriptionum Nova Collectio Prolegomenis et Notis Illustrata, et Iterum Cum Emendationibus, & Auctariis Evulgata, 2nd (1st is 1769) (Palermo: typis regiis, 1784), http://arachne.uni-koeln.de/books/Castelli1784
Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae

Th. Mommsen, Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars Posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae, Corpus Inscriptionum Latinarum, Consilio et Auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae Editum, 10.2 (Berlin: G. Reimer, 1883)
Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese
Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese, vol. 9/8, Kokalos Supplementi / Sikelika serie storica (Palermo / Rome, 1994)
Le iscrizioni greche e latine di Messina
I. Bitto, Le Iscrizioni Greche e Latine Di Messina, vol. 1, Pelorias 7 (Messina: Dipartimento di Scienze dell’Antichità dell’Università degli Studi di Messina, 2001)
Lucio ❦ Acilio Advento Helias ❦ pio coiugiconiugi

1L(ucio) ivy-leaf Acilio
2Advento
3Helias ivy-leaf pio
4coiugi

l.4 reg., orig. coiugi

1Livy-leafACILIO
2ADVENTO
3HELIASivy-leafPIO
4COIUGI

l.4 reg., orig. coiugi

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Fazello and Gualtherus;
  • 2: Gualtherus 1624[1625]: ADVENIO
  • 4: Fazello: CONIUGI

English translation

Helias (set this up) for her dutiful husband Lucius Acilius Adventus.

commentary

The reports in Fazello and Gualtherus make it highly likely that this stone was originally found in Termini (like the others attested in private houses in the 16th and 17th century in the town), but was subsequently transferred to a collector in Messana, where Gualtherus saw it. Bitto provides an extended discussion of the onomastics, but the assumption that it is from Messana is unjustified, and her attribution of the reading 'Adventus' to a correction of Mommsen is to ignore the original report in Fazello / misread Mommsen's apparatus. It seems preferable however to follow Gualtherus' report of the form 'coiugi' over Fazello's likely 'normalisation' of 'coniugi'.
